newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil 1996 GDP growth seen at 3.2 pct-IPEA.
newsitem.headline: Brazil 1996 GDP growth seen at 3.2 pct-IPEA.

text.p: Brazilian gross domestic product (GDP) growth is expected to be 3.2 percent for 1996, according to Brazil's Applied Economics Research Institute (Ipea).
Paulo Levy, coordinator of Ipea's economic affairs department, said Brazil's 1996 GDP growth was seen at 3.2 percent, but he declined to make any forecast for 1997.
Ipea's GDP estimate is due to be published officially in its January bulletin due out Friday.
((--Simona de Logu, Rio de Janeiro newsroom, 5521 507 4151))
